Calcium

Calcium 99% of Ca++ is found in bone as hydroxyapatite. Of circulating Ca++, 50% is free, 45% is protein bound, and 5% bound to anions (eg citrate, lactate). Normal range 2.2-2.6 mmol/l, correction for albumin = 0.02*(40-[Alb]).

Controlled by the level of

Parathyroid hormone see nephron.

Calcitonin

Acitvated vitamin D (1,25 dihydroxycholecalciferol)
